lexUnit.name: shop.n

document.description: Berlitz What to Do in Hong Kong
document.name: WhatToHongKong

document.description: Berlitz Where to Go in Hong Kong
document.name: WhereToHongKong

lexUnit.definition: COD: a building or part of a building where goods or services are sold.

sentence.text: The constantly crowded and busy Grafton street is the most visible center for shopping , but there are shops all over that carry an international array of goods as well as the Irish crafts and souvenirs you expect .
Many shops , and also hotels and guest houses , have been owned and managed by the same families for years , and theirs is the welcome of traditional Dublin hospitality .
At the upper terminus there is a four - level shopping center , the Peak Galleria , and the Peak Tower , which resembles an airport control tower and has shops , entertainment , and restaurants .
The Western District is one of Hong Kong 's oldest neighborhoods , and its narrow streets hold a collection of fascinating traditional shops and enterprises .
For an interesting glimpse of small and family - owned shops , walk along Bonham Strand East and West , Man Wa Lane , and Cleverly Street .
You 'll find herb and medicine shops , incense shops , chop makers ' shops ( makers of Chinese seals ) , and more .
Here the windows and open doors of the shops reveal an alluring selection of Asian furniture , carpets , carvings , tomb figures , porcelain , and bronze .
Go down one flight of steps to Lascar Row , popularly known as Cat Street , for more antiques and curio shops .
The center contains a concert hall with acclaimed acoustics , theaters , a library , an exhibition gallery , shops , restaurants , and bars .
The museum mounts special exhibitions and has an excellent gift shop .
Alongside the hotel runs busy Nathan Road , Hong Kong 's fabled shopping street , lined with shops , hotels , and restaurants .

The individual artisans ' shops are no longer here , but you can visit a silk - weaving factory , a ceramics plant , and the Foshan Folk Art Studio , where you can observe workers making Chinese lanterns , carving sculptures , painting scrolls , and cutting intricate designs in paper .
Opposite the Sha Tin railway station , New Town Plaza features shops , cinemas , and even a computer - controlled musical fountain .
Look for jewelry shops along Avenida do Infante D. Henrique and Avenida de Almeida Ribeiro .
Browsing is a real pleasure in Macau 's main streets and byways , where shops aimed at the tourist market are interspersed with the more workaday ironmongers , herbalists , and noodle stalls .
A recreated street of colonial Macau is lined with traditional Chinese shops .
Its spin-off industries , prostitution and pawn shops , also thrive .
Large shops on the fashionable thoroughfares tend to be more expensive than smaller `` family '' shops tucked away in the side streets .
Most shops are open seven days a week .
Shops in Central are an exception ; they generally close at 6 pm and are not open on Sunday .
